cRefPattern.p: This pattern references a specific line.
This pattern references an inscribed surface on an object.

div.l: Brother(!?) with a beautiful face, he has advised his father
May you be our brother, may you be our brother
May you be our ... of/at the gate of the palace
May you be our lord of the prow of the barge
May you be our captain of the chariot
May you be our groom who runs (alongside?) the chariot
May you be our city elder who decides cases
Brother, may you be the son-in-law(!?) of(?) our father
May you be our son-in-law whose neck is raised
May my mother say good things with you(? i.e. converse)
Your having come is indeed life
When you enter the house, it is abundance
"I want to lie down‚Äù is my surpassing rejoicing
My sweet, let (us?) delight ourselves(!?) in the bedroom
